requirement_tested: A frontend application with cartoon-style visual design using seashell for container backgrounds and crimson for component visuals
user_persona: An 8-year-old child visiting the recycling game website for the first time.
user_goal: To immediately feel welcomed by a fun, colorful interface that looks like a cartoon game.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on the Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Emma opens the website and sees a bright, playful interface with containers that look like seashells and buttons in crimson red.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with a cartoon-style layout featuring seashell backgrounds for containers and crimson-colored interactive components.

requirement_tested: Game interface allowing children to sort waste items into correct recycling containers
user_persona: A curious 9-year-old eager to play the recycling game.
user_goal: To drag and drop a cartoon waste item into the matching recycling bin.

narrative_steps.title: Starting the Game
narrative_steps.description: Jake sees several waste item icons on the left and four labeled recycling bins on the right.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the game interface with draggable items and bins.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Cartoon-style waste items are displayed on one side, and four clearly labeled recycling bins with seashell backgrounds appear on the other.

narrative_steps.title: Dragging an Item
narrative_steps.description: Jake picks up a cartoon plastic bottle and drags it toward the plastic bin.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the plastic bottle image onto the 'Plastic' bin.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The item follows the cursor during drag and can be dropped into the bin.

requirement_tested: Real-time feedback system that informs kids whether their sorting decisions are correct or incorrect
user_persona: A 7-year-old learning how to recycle properly.
user_goal: To know instantly if she sorted the item correctly.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting a Waste Item
narrative_steps.description: Sophie drops a paper item into the paper bin and waits to see if she did it right.
narrative_steps.action: Drop a paper item into the 'Paper' bin.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A popup appears saying 'Great job!' with a happy emoji and a cheerful sound plays.

narrative_steps.title: Making a Mistake
narrative_steps.description: Next, Sophie accidentally drops a glass jar into the paper bin.
narrative_steps.action: Drop a glass item into the 'Paper' bin.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A popup says 'Try again!' with a gentle correction message and a soft chime plays.

requirement_tested: Reward and recognition system that provides incentives for correct recycling choices
user_persona: A competitive 10-year-old aiming to earn as many stars as possible.
user_goal: To earn a star every time he sorts an item correctly.

narrative_steps.title: Correct Sorting Action
narrative_steps.description: Leo drops a correct item into the matching bin and watches his reward counter.
narrative_steps.action: Drag and drop a correct item into its bin.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A star icon animates near the top-right corner, and the reward counter increases by one.

requirement_tested: Leaderboard feature displaying top-performing players to encourage competition
user_persona: A determined 11-year-old wanting to see if she made it to the top of the leaderboard.
user_goal: To scroll through the leaderboard and find her name among the top players.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Leaderboard
narrative_steps.description: Maya scrolls down to the bottom of the page to see the leaderboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A scrollable panel shows player names, avatars, and scores in descending order.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Her Name
narrative_steps.description: She scrolls down further and spots her username ranked 5th.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll vertically within the leaderboard container.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: More leaderboard entries become visible, including Maya's entry with her avatar and score.

requirement_tested: Backend API to manage game data, player scores, and leaderboard information
user_persona: A returning player logging in to continue improving his score.
user_goal: To have his sorting actions recorded and reflected in the leaderboard.

narrative_steps.title: Playing the Game
narrative_steps.description: Ethan completes a round of sorting items correctly.
narrative_steps.action: Complete a sorting round and submit results via frontend.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: POST request is sent to /api/game endpoint, and Ethan's score updates in real-time on the leaderboard.

requirement_tested: Database connection to PostgreSQL using environment variables DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, DB_NAME
user_persona: A developer checking if the app connects to the database correctly.
user_goal: To confirm that the backend service successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Developer runs the backend service locally and checks logs.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server using npm run dev.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Logs indicate successful connection to PostgreSQL using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.

requirement_tested: Player authentication or identification system to track individual progress and scores
user_persona: A new player joining the game for the first time.
user_goal: To enter a username and start playing with a unique identity.

narrative_steps.title: Registering a Username
narrative_steps.description: Nina fills out a simple form with her chosen username.
narrative_steps.action: Enter a unique username and click Register.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System creates a new player profile with a UUID and returns an identifier for tracking.

requirement_tested: Interactive game elements with engaging animations and sound effects for children
user_persona: A playful 6-year-old enjoying the game's lively interactions.
user_goal: To hear fun sounds and see animations when sorting items.

narrative_steps.title: Dropping an Item
narrative_steps.description: Zoe drops a correct item and watches it bounce before disappearing.
narrative_steps.action: Drop an item into the correct bin.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Item bounces slightly, disappears with animation, and a cheerful jingle plays.

requirement_tested: Educational content explaining proper waste recycling methods integrated into gameplay
user_persona: A curious 9-year-old wanting to learn more about recycling.
user_goal: To understand what items go in each bin by clicking the info icons.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Recycling Info
narrative_steps.description: Owen clicks the info icon next to the plastic bin.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'i' icon beside the Plastic bin.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal pops up showing cartoon illustrations and text explaining what goes in the plastic bin.

requirement_tested: Progress tracking system to show children's improvement over time
user_persona: A motivated 10-year-old checking how much better she's gotten.
user_goal: To view her progress chart and celebrate improvements.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Progress Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Lily clicks the 'My Progress' tab to see her stats.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dashboard loads showing line charts of her accuracy rate and score growth over time.

requirement_tested: Responsive design that works across different devices including tablets and desktops
user_persona: A kid accessing the game from his mom’s tablet during a car ride.
user_goal: To play the game smoothly on a tablet without layout issues.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Game on Tablet
narrative_steps.description: Max opens the game on his mom’s tablet and begins playing.
narrative_steps.action: Open the game URL on a tablet browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts to fit the tablet screen with appropriately sized touch targets and readable fonts.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'npm run install:all' script to install both frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A developer setting up the project for the first time.
user_goal: To quickly install all necessary dependencies for frontend and backend.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Dev runs the command to install everything at once.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both client and server dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'npm run dev' script to start both frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer ready to begin coding on both frontend and backend.
user_goal: To launch both development servers with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Dev runs the command to start both frontend and backend dev servers.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers start concurrently with logs prefixed as CLIENT and SERV.

requirement_tested: Data persistence for storing player scores, leaderboard rankings, and game statistics
user_persona: A frequent player returning after a week to continue improving.
user_goal: To see that his previous scores and progress are still saved.

narrative_steps.title: Resuming Play
narrative_steps.description: Alex logs in and checks his leaderboard position and past scores.
narrative_steps.action: Log in and navigate to leaderboard and progress sections.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Previous scores, ranking, and historical data are accurately retrieved from the database.
